intro: Lycopodioides plumosa, commonly known as the feather moss, is a member of the Lycopodiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, carpet-like growth habit. It features small, needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem, giving it a feathery appearance. The plant produces microsporangia and megasporangia on separate sporophylls, which are specialized leaves for spore production. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or along stream banks. Lycopodioides plumosa plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
